glsa.title: Bochs: Multiple vulnerabilities
glsa.synopsis: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Bochs, possibly allowing for the execution of arbitrary code or a Denial of Service.

background.p: Bochs is a IA-32 (x86) PC emulator written in C++.

description.p: Tavis Ormandy of the Google Security Team discovered a heap-based overflow vulnerability in the NE2000 driver (CVE-2007-2893). He also discovered a divide-by-zero error in the emulated floppy disk controller (CVE-2007-2894).

impact.p: A local attacker in the guest operating system could exploit these issues to execute code outside of the virtual machine, or cause Bochs to crash.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
